page.title: 07DAIRY FARMING - STRANRAER
page.content: The farming around Stranraer is mainly{Dairy}or dairy related. The largest creamery of its kind in Europe is in Stranraer. 'Gallahill Farm' is typical of the kind of farm found in the area. {*Gallahill Farm* This farm has a herd of{80}milking cows and 30 young cows in calf. The farm stock also includes 50 mixed dairy and beef calves and the all important farm cats. The farmer mostly grows grass as a crop for silage. Turnips and kale were sown in May and a little barley will be ready for harvesting in late July. This will also be used for silage. Machinery found on the farm includes tractors, silage cutters, harvesters and threshers. A milk tanker calls daily to collect the milk for the Galloway Creamery.
